pageContext.claim: “By the way, didn't you love the fact that I got funding for wall? We're building it anyway. … So we've built almost 100 miles already. It's going up rapidly, and it's the real deal.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump could not get the massive concrete wall he wanted funded by Congress, not even when both chambers were controlled by Republicans. Instead, the Trump administration has grabbed military funds destined for Puerto Rico's rebuilding and for schools for the children of military officials and repurposed them toward building replacement fencing along the border. The 100 miles he's talking about are all replacement fencing -- none of it went up in areas that did not previously have barriers. And Trump has downshifted his ambitions and is now building a system of see-through, bollard-style fences -- which can be cut through with a modified power saw.
